p: We also observed regional differences in species abundance shifts ( Fig. 4). The majority of species (85%) centered in the warm continental Northern Hardwood region shifted their abundance poleward at a median rate of 20.1 km per decade. Species centered in the hot continental Central Hardwood region shifted primarily westward (83%) at a median rate of 18.9 km per decade. Similarly, species centered in the subtropical Southern Pine-Hardwood region also had a primarily westward shift (77%) at a median rate of 24.7 km per decade. Species centered in the Forest-Prairie Transition region had a westward shift at a median rate of 30.0 km per decade.
